intro: Onosmodium discolor, commonly known as the spotted nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Urticaceae family, which includes many species of stinging nettles. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs and have a distinctive spotted or mottled appearance. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and it is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a short growing season and is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
